title: How to Evolve Morty

steps.headline: Open the Pocket Mortys game on your iPhone, Android or computer.
steps.description: The Pocket Mortys icon looks like Rick's face from the TV show Rick and Morty on a blue background. If the game doesn't automatically open up to the gameplay map, tap the PLAY button.

steps.headline: Enter the Day Care Center with your main character.
steps.description: The Day Care Center is an orange building in the gameplay map's Central Hub. You can step on one of the orange arrow icons in front of the Day Care Center to enter.

steps.headline: Click or tap Evolve Mortys in the Day Care Center.
steps.description: This is a yellow button at the bottom of your screen. It will open your Morty list. On some versions of the game, you'll see a Combine button instead. In this case, tap Combine.

steps.headline: Select the Morty you want to evolve.
steps.description: Find and click/tap the kind of Morty you want to evolve on the Morty list here. If you're using the Combine option instead of Evolve Mortys, select all the duplicates of the same type of Morty here, and just tap Combine on the bottom-right.

steps.headline: Click or tap the Blender on the bottom-right.
steps.description: This is a green button in the lower-right corner of the page. This will open a list of all duplicates of the same type of Morty you have.

steps.headline: Select all the Mortys you want to blend.
steps.description: Blending multiple duplicates of the same type of Morty will use up the selected Mortys, and evolve them into one single copy of the higher evolution form of this type. Used duplicates of this Morty type will disappear from your Morty list.

steps.headline: Tap Blend on the bottom-right.
steps.description: This will blend all the selected Mortys, and fill up your Morty's evolution (EVO) bar on the Morty list. This will take you back to your Morty list.

steps.headline: Blend the same type of Mortys until the EVO (evolution) bar is full.
steps.description: The EVO bar is next to your Morty's level on the Morty list. When it's full, your Morty will automatically evolve into its higher evolution form.

text: Open the Pocket Mortys game on your iPhone, Android or computer. The Pocket Mortys icon looks like Rick's face from the TV show Rick and Morty on a blue background. If the game doesn't automatically open up to the gameplay map, tap the PLAY button. Enter the Day Care Center with your main character. The Day Care Center is an orange building in the gameplay map's Central Hub. You can step on one of the orange arrow icons in front of the Day Care Center to enter. Click or tap Evolve Mortys in the Day Care Center. This is a yellow button at the bottom of your screen. It will open your Morty list. On some versions of the game, you'll see a Combine button instead. In this case, tap Combine. Select the Morty you want to evolve. Find and click/tap the kind of Morty you want to evolve on the Morty list here. If you're using the Combine option instead of Evolve Mortys, select all the duplicates of the same type of Morty here, and just tap Combine on the bottom-right. Click or tap the Blender on the bottom-right. This is a green button in the lower-right corner of the page. This will open a list of all duplicates of the same type of Morty you have. Select all the Mortys you want to blend. Blending multiple duplicates of the same type of Morty will use up the selected Mortys, and evolve them into one single copy of the higher evolution form of this type. Used duplicates of this Morty type will disappear from your Morty list. Tap Blend on the bottom-right. This will blend all the selected Mortys, and fill up your Morty's evolution (EVO) bar on the Morty list. This will take you back to your Morty list. Blend the same type of Mortys until the EVO (evolution) bar is full. The EVO bar is next to your Morty's level on the Morty list. When it's full, your Morty will automatically evolve into its higher evolution form.
